page.title: 06KILMERSDON-CHARLTON-HOUSES
page.content: THE MANOR HOUSE - Kilmersdon, Elizabethan, with Georgian wing added. THE OLD SCHOOL - built in l707, has fine oak staircase and oak panelling. THE OLD VICARAGE - a harmonious jumble of styles with l4C wing and later Elizabethan and Georgian additions. HAMILTONS - large Victorian vicarage built in l863 to replace the old vicarage. Now in secular occupation. HAYES - built in l912 by the architect of Bristol University. Formerly the Estate Factor's residence, now in private occupation. THE TOLL HOUSE - originally at the top of the hill at the Trowbridge/Radstock fork - now on village edge. PROSPECT HOUSE - in Charlton. A three storey Georgian Town House built on the foundations of an old cottage, and seems oddly situated in its rural surroundings.
